name: Stethoscope
specification: Flexible tubing connecting stainless steel chestpiece (with diaphragm and bell) to soft ear tips; includes metal stem linking chestpiece and tubing; designed for clear sound transmission.
function: Amplifies internal body sounds such as heartbeats, lung sounds, and bowel movements for diagnostic assessment.
usage: Place the chestpiece directly on patient’s skin; use diaphragm side for high-pitched sounds and bell side for low-pitched sounds; listen carefully through earpieces.
maintenance: Clean ear tips, tubing, and chestpiece regularly using alcohol wipes; inspect for damage or wear; replace parts as needed to maintain sound quality.
warning: Using a dirty or damaged stethoscope can spread infection and reduce acoustic clarity.

Bell.description: The bell is a small, cylindrical device that vibrates when the chestpiece is placed on the patient’s skin. It is used to amplify the low-frequency sounds of the chestpiece, such as heartbeats, lung sounds, and bowel movements.

Ear Tips.description: Ear tips are soft rubber or silicone pieces attached to the ends of the ear tubes. They have a small opening for sound and must be both soft and firm enough to seal the ear canal and block external noise.

Tubing.description: The tubing is a flexible, rubber tube that connects the chestpiece to the ear tubes. It is flexible enough to bend and stretch, but not so tight that it can cause discomfort or damage to the ears.
